intro: Calophanes jasminum-mexicanum var. macranthes, commonly known as Mexican jasmine, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly waxy texture. The flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
